method.name: atmosphere
method.shortdescription: Construct an atmosphere tool
method.description: This is used to construct an {\tt atmosphere} tool.
method.example:
A default atmosphere tool is created automatically during casapy startup and defined as 'at'. Manual tool construction is done this way:
at = casac.atmosphere()

method.shortdescription: Destroy the atmosphere tool
method.example: at.close()

method.name: done
method.shortdescription: Destroy the atmosphere tool
method.example: at.done()

method.shortdescription: Returns the version of ATM library.
method.description: Returns the version of ATM library implemented to this tool.
method.returns: The ATM library tag.
method.example: at.getAtmVersion() # 'ATM-0_5_0'

method.shortdescription: Returns a list of atmospheric types used by ATM.

method.name: initAtmProfile
method.shortdescription: Set initial atmospheric profile for atmosphere tool
method.description:
An atmospheric profile is composed of 4 quantities as a function of altitude z:
* the layer thickness * the pressure P * the temperature T and * the gas densities for H2O, O3, CO and N2O.
This method is needed for computing the absorption and phase coefficients, as well as for performing radiative transfer calculations (only layer thickness/T are needed).
This method builds an atmospheric profile that can be used to calculate absorption and phase coefficients, as well as to perform forward and/or retrieval radiative transfer calculations. It is composed of a set of parameters needed to build a layer thickness/P/T/gas densities densities profile from simple parameters currently available at observatories (from weather stations for example) using functions from the ATM library. The set of input parameters consists of the pressure P, the temperature T and the relative humidity at the ground, the altitude of the site, the tropospheric temperature lapse rate,... The profile is built as: thickness of the considered atmospheric layers above the site, and mean P,T,H2O,O3,CO,N2O in them. The total number of atmospheric layers in the particular profile is also available (a negative value indicates an error). The zenith column of water vapor can be calculated by simply integrating the H2O profile.

param.name: altitude
param.description: Site altitude - Quantity with units of altitude, meter

param.name: temperature
param.description: Ambient Temperature - Quantity with units of temperature, K

param.name: pressure
param.description: Ambient pressure - Quantity with units of pressure, mbar

param.name: maxAltitude
param.description: altitude of the top pf the modelled atmosphere - Quantity with dimension of length, and units of kilometer

param.name: humidity
param.description: used to guess water (0-100)

param.name: dTem_dh
param.description: the derivative of temperature with respect to height - Quantity with units of K/km

param.name: dP
param.description: initial pressure step - Quantity with the units of pressure, mb

param.name: dPm
param.description: pressure multiplicative factor for steps

param.name: h0
param.description: scale height for water( exp distribution ) - Quantity with the dimension of length, and units of kilometer

param.name: atmType
param.description: atmospheric type 1(tropical),2(mid latitude summer),3(mid latitude winter), 4(subarctic summer),5(subarctic winter), dimensionless

param.name: layerBoundaries
param.description: Altitude of user-defined temperature profile, a double array in unit of meter

param.name: layerTemperature
param.description: User-defined temperature profile, a double array in unit of Kelvin

method.returns: String displaying input values.
method.example:
tmp = qa.quantity(270.0, 'K') pre = qa.quantity(560.0, 'mbar') hum = 20.0 alt = qa.quantity(5000, 'm') h0 = qa.quantity(2.0, 'km') wvl = qa.quantity(-5.6, 'K/km') mxA = qa.quantity(48, 'km') dpr = qa.quantity(10.0, 'mbar') dpm = 1.2 att = 1 myatm = at.initAtmProfile(alt, tmp, pre, mxA, hum, wvl, dpr, dpm, h0, att) print myatm # BASIC ATMOSPHERIC PARAMETERS TO GENERATE REFERENCE ATMOSPHERIC PROFILE # # Ground temperature T: 270 K # Ground pressure P: 560 mb # Relative humidity rh: 20 % # Scale height h0: 2 km # Pressure step dp: 10 mb # Altitude alti: 5000 m # Attitude top atm profile: 48 km # Pressure step factor: 1.2 # Tropospheric lapse rate: -5.6 K/km # Atmospheric type: TROPICAL # User-defined temperature profile: OFF # # Built atmospheric profile with 19 layers.
User-defined temperature profile myalt = [ 5071.72200397, 6792.36546384, 15727.0776121, 42464.18192672 ] #meter mytemp = [ 270., 264., 258., 252. ] #Kelvin newatm = at.initAtmProfile(alt, tmp, pre, mxA, hum, wvl, dpr, dpm, h0, att, myalt, mytemp) print newatm # BASIC ATMOSPHERIC PARAMETERS TO GENERATE REFERENCE ATMOSPHERIC PROFILE # # Ground temperature T: 270 K # Ground pressure P: 560 mb # Relative humidity rh: 20 % # Scale height h0: 2 km # Pressure step dp: 10 mb # Altitude alti: 5000 m # Attitude top atm profile: 48 km # Pressure step factor: 1.2 # Tropospheric lapse rate: -5.6 K/km # Atmospheric type: TROPICAL # User-defined temperature profile: ON # # Built atmospheric profile with 19 layers.

param.description: pressure multiplicative factor for steps

method.name: getNumLayers
method.shortdescription: Returns the number of layers in the atmospheric profile.
method.example: p = at.getProfile() for i in range(at.getNumLayers()): # Print atmospheric profile returned by at.getProfile(): # Layer thickness (idx=1), Temperature (idx=2), # Number density of water vapor(idx=4), and Pressure (idx=5) print p[1]['value'][i], p[2]['value'][i], p[4]['value'][i], p[5]['value'][i]

method.name: getGroundWH2O
method.shortdescription: get the zenith column of water vapor
method.description: Method to get the zenith column of water vapor. It is computed by simply integrating the H2O profile:
method.example: w = at.getGroundWH2O() print "Guessed water content: ", w['value'][0], w['unit'] # Guessed water content: 2.6529103462750112 mm

method.name: getProfile
method.shortdescription: get atmospheric profile
method.description: Get the atmospheric profile.

param.name: thickness
param.description: thickness of every atmospheric layer - Quantum with a vector value and unit of length, m

param.name: temperature
param.description: temperature of every atmospheric layer - Quantum with a vector value and unit of temperature, K

param.name: watermassdensity
param.description: water vapor mass density content of every atmospheric layer - Quantum with a vector value and unit of kg.m-3

param.name: water
param.description: water vapor content of every atmospheric layer - Quantum with a vector value and unit of m-3

param.name: pressure
param.description: pressure of every atmospheric layer - Quantum with a vector value and unit of Pascal

param.name: O3
param.description: O3 of every atmospheric layer - Quantum with a vector value and unit of m-3

param.name: CO
param.description: CO of every atmospheric layer - Quantum with a vector value and unit of m-3

param.name: N2O
param.description: N2O of every atmospheric layer - Quantum with a vector value and unit of m-3

method.returns: String displaying atmospheric profile
method.example:
p = at.getProfile() # returns a tuple of # 0 - string listing of layer values, and arrays of layer, 1 - thickness, # 2 - temperature, 3 - watermassdensity, 4 - water (number density), # 5 - pressure, 6 - O3 (number density), 7 - CO, 8 - N2O for i in range(at.getNumLayers()): # Print atmospheric profile returned by at.getProfile(): # Layer thickness (idx=1), Temperature (idx=2), # Number density of water vapor(idx=4), and Pressure (idx=5) print p[1]['value'][i], p[2]['value'][i], p[4]['value'][i],\ p[5]['value'][i]
print p[0] # "pretty" listing of all layer parameters

method.name: initSpectralWindow
method.shortdescription: initialize spectral window

param.name: nbands
param.description: number of spectral windows/bands. The value must be > 0.

param.name: fCenter
param.description: center frequencies - Quantum with a vector value and unit of frequency, GHz

param.name: fWidth
param.description: frequency width of band - Quantum with a vector value and unit of frequency, GHz

param.name: fRes
param.description: resolution inside band - Quantum with a vector value and unit frequency, GHz. Default is for a single frequency.

method.returns: Number of channels in the first spectral window
method.example:
nb = 1 fC = qa.quantity(88., 'GHz') fW = qa.quantity(0.5, 'GHz') fR = qa.quantity(0.5, 'GHz') at.initSpectralWindow(nb, fC, fW, fR)
nb = 2 fC = qa.quantity([88., 90.], 'GHz') fW = qa.quantity([0.5, 0.5], 'GHz') fR = qa.quantity([0.125, 0.125], 'GHz') at.initSpectralWindow(nb, fC, fW, fR)

method.name: addSpectralWindow
method.shortdescription: add a new spectral window
method.description: Add a new spectral window, uniformly sampled, this spectral window having no sideband.

param.name: fCenter
param.description: frequencies - Quantum with a double value and unit of frequency, GHz

param.name: fWidth
param.description: frequency width of band - Quantum with a double value and unit of frequency, GHz

param.name: fRes
param.description: resolution inside band - Quantum with a double value and unit frequency, GHz

method.returns: Number of channels in new spectral window
method.example: fC2 = qa.quantity(350.0, 'GHz') fW2 = qa.quantity(0.008, 'GHz') fR2 = qa.quantity(0.002, 'GHz') nc = at.addSpectralWindow(fC2, fW2, fR2) print "New spectral window has ", nc, " channels"
